001package gust.backend.model;
002
003import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
004import java.util.Optional;
005import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
006
007
008/**
009 * Specifies operational options related to caching. These options are usable orthogonally to the main
010 * {@link OperationOptions} tree. See below for a description of each configurable property.
011 *
012 * <p><b>Cache configuration (<b>defaults</b> in parens):
013 * <ul>
014 *   <li>{@link #enableCache()} ({@code true}): Whether to allow caching at all.</li>
015 *   <li>{@link #cacheTimeout()} ({@code 1}): Amount of time to give the cache before falling back to storage.</li>
016 *   <li>{@link #cacheTimeoutUnit()} ({@code SECONDS}): Time unit to correspond with {@code cacheTimeoutValue}.</li>
017 *   <li>{@link #cacheDefaultTTL()}: Default amount of time to let things stick around in the cache.</li>
018 *   <li>{@link #cacheDefaultTTLUnit()}: Time unit to correspond with {@code cacheDefaultTTL}.</li>
019 *   <li>{@link #cacheEvictionMode()}: Eviction mode to operate in.
020 * </ul></p>
021 */
022public interface CacheOptions extends OperationOptions {
023  /** Describes operating modes with regard to cache eviction. */
024  enum EvictionMode {
025    /** Flag to enable TTL enforcement. */
026    TTL("Time-to-Live"),
027
028    /** Least-Frequently-Used mode for cache eviction. */
029    LFU("Least-Frequently Used"),
030
031    /** Least-Recently-Used mode for cache eviction. */
032    LRU("Least-Recently Used");
033
034    /** Pretty label for this mode. */
035    private final @Nonnull String label;
036
037    EvictionMode(@Nonnull String label) {
038      this.label = label;
039    }
040
041    @Override
042    public String toString() {
043      return String.format("EvictionMode(%s - %s)", this.name(), this.label);
044    }
045
046    /** @return Human-readable label for this eviction mode. */
047    public @Nonnull String getLabel() {
048      return label;
049    }
050  }
051
052  /** @return Whether the cache should be enabled, if installed. Defaults to `true`. */
053  default @Nonnull Boolean enableCache() {
054    return true;
055  }
056
057  /** @return Value to apply to the cache timeout. If left unspecified, the global default is used. */
058  default @Nonnull Optional<Long> cacheTimeout() {
059    return Optional.of(2L);
060  }
061
062  /** @return Unit to apply to the cache timeout. If left unspecified, the global default is used. */
063  default @Nonnull TimeUnit cacheTimeoutUnit() {
064    return TimeUnit.SECONDS;
065  }
066
067  /** @return Default amount of time to let things remain in the cache. */
068  default @Nonnull Optional<Long> cacheDefaultTTL() {
069    return Optional.of(1L);
070  }
071
072  /** @return Unit to apply to the default cache lifetime (TTL) value. */
073  default @Nonnull TimeUnit cacheDefaultTTLUnit() {
074    return TimeUnit.HOURS;
075  }
076
077  /** @return Specifier describing the cache eviction mode to apply, if any. */
078  default @Nonnull Optional<EvictionMode> cacheEvictionMode() {
079    return Optional.of(EvictionMode.TTL);
080  }
081}
